messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item
messages.msgSnippet: Dennis- Nihonto Message Board. Post there. ________________________________ From: Dennis oldphardt@yahoo.com [nihontostudy]
messages.messageBody:
Dennis-

Nihonto Message Board.
Post there.


From: "Dennis oldphardt@... [nihontostudy]" <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
To: "nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com" <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 27, 2014 11:28 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item

 
Thanks, Ron.   I did get 2 responses to this list and nothing from attempts to post on Chris' list,   Do you have any other suggestions for selling this piece?   I hate to just post the photos on ebay as the piece will be lost in the junk replicas there. 

Dennis



From: "'Ron Hartmann' swords@... [nihontostudy]" <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, May 27, 2014 7:34 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item

 
ï»¿
This site and also Chris Bowen's group does not allow photos. But, you can post them someplace like Photobucket and then attach a link to your folder here. I haven't done that myself for almost a year, so you'll have to brush up on posting photos on Photobucket; its free and easy to do.
 
Ron STL
 


----- Original Message -----
From: 'Jim Meyer' tantojim@... [nihontostudy]
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, May 27, 2014 12:12 AM
Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item

 
No dice.

Sent: Sunday, May 25, 2014 8:19 PM

D

>-------- Original Message --------
>>Subject: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item

>><nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>

>>Gentlemen.

>>    I am re-shuffling my stuff and came up with an old tsuba that I think is early Aizu Ju Shoami.   It us signed, round, iron, and has gold inlayed lines.   I can post photos or contact directly.   I will probably sell this piece as it at 3 1/8 inch diameter is a bit small for the 1860s sword I had intended it for.    Dennis
>

>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item
messages.msgSnippet: ( The group has a photo space ( https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/Nihontostudy/photos/albumsÂ  ) and I have added a new album for uploading but all I get is
messages.messageBody:
(
The group has a photo space ( https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/Nihontostudy/photos/albums  ) and I have added a new album for uploading but all I get is 'sorry an error has occurred' when I try to upload a photo.  This, assume, has to do with who can and can not post photos.   Perhaps I am just to new a member.   Can anyone who has been a member for some time post photos?   The latest photos I saw were from 2013.   Perhaps it is just some new security concern.

Dennis



From: "'Jim Meyer' tantojim@... [nihontostudy]" <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item
messages.msgSnippet: This site and also Chris Bowen s group does not allow photos. But, you can post them someplace like Photobucket and then attach a link to your folder here. I
messages.messageBody:
ï»¿
This site and also Chris Bowen's group does not allow photos. But, you can post them someplace like Photobucket and then attach a link to your folder here. I haven't done that myself for almost a year, so you'll have to brush up on posting photos on Photobucket; its free and easy to do.
 
Ron STL

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: [nihontostudy] New to the group - Tsuba item
From: "Dennis oldphardt@... [nihontostudy]"
<nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Tue, May 13, 2014 8:30 pm
To: "nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com" <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>

 
Gentlemen.  
    I am re-shuffling my stuff and came up with an old tsuba that I think is early Aizu Ju Shoami.   It us signed, round, iron, and has gold inlayed lines.   I can post photos or contact directly.   I will probably sell this piece as it at 3 1/8 inch diameter is a bit small for the 1860s sword I had intended it for.    Dennis

messages.subject: New to the group - Tsuba item
messages.msgSnippet: Gentlemen.Â Â  Â Â Â  I am re-shuffling my stuff and came up with an old tsuba that I think is early Aizu Ju Shoami.Â Â  It us signed, round, iron, and has
messages.messageBody:
Gentlemen.  
    I am re-shuffling my stuff and came up with an old tsuba that I think is early Aizu Ju Shoami.   It us signed, round, iron, and has gold inlayed lines.   I can post photos or contact directly.   I will probably sell this piece as it at 3 1/8 inch diameter is a bit small for the 1860s sword I had intended it for.    Dennis
